tool.name: Settings

param.name: config_read
param.dialogReference: The config file used to prepopulate the parameters. It can be changed after the tool is opened.
param.pythonReference: When the tool is opened, the value is read from config_location.txt. This stores the config file that was written to last. When the tool is first installed, the included config_default.txt will be used.

param.name: parcel_layer
param.dialogReference: Tax parcel polygon layer. This should be the only layer that features are selected from. Must contain parcel ID field, and deeded acreage field if that option is selected. This is a parameter in OpenFarms.

param.name: landuse_layer
param.dialogReference: Land use polygon layer. Must contain land use field. Must cover entire area of selected parcels. This is a parameter in OpenFarms.

param.name: soil_layer
param.dialogReference: Soil polygon layer. Must contain soil type field. Must cover entire area of selected parcels. This is a parameter in OpenFarms.

param.name: parcel_field
param.dialogReference: Unqiue ID for parcels. Field type can be numeric or text. Can include or exclude dashes '-'. When writing to a txt file, the dashes are removed. This is a parameter in OpenFarms.

param.name: landuse_field
param.dialogReference: Land use abreviation. Field type can be numeric or text, but text is recommended. String that corresponds to land use codes specified in the Settings tool. This is a parameter in OpenFarms.

param.name: soil_field
param.dialogReference: Soil type with letters and numbers. Field type can be numeric or text, but text is recommended. Should be in format 123X1. The text file splits the soil type into two parts at the letter. If no number is given after the letter, the default is 1. If no letter is given either, the default is A1. 'W' is also accepted. This is a parameter in OpenFarms.

param.name: bool_deeded
param.displayname: Use Deeded Acreage instead of GIS Acreage
param.dialogReference: If this is selected and a valid deeded acreage field is given, deeded acreage will be used instead of GIS acreage. Manual acreage in the main OpenFarms tool will still override the deeded acreage field.

param.name: deeded_field
param.dialogReference: Field that conatains deeded acreage values. Must be in parcel layer. Field type must be numeric. If value is null for a selected parcel, GIS acreage will be used.

param.name: bool_flood
param.dialogReference: If this is selected and a layer and field are given, the tool will also intersect the layers with the flood debasement layer. If this is not selected the default multiplier is 1.00. Flood debasement is not included in the csv.

param.name: flood_layer
param.dialogReference: Polygon layer that contains the flood debasement multiplier field. Does not need to cover entire area of selected parcels (1.00 will be the default in excluded areas), but should not contain overlapping polygons.

param.name: flood_field
param.dialogReference: Flood debasement multiplier field. Field type must be numeric. If value is null, 1.00 will be used. Flood debasement is only included in the txt file.

param.name: output_folder
param.dialogReference: The folder where the txt and/or csv files will be written. This is a parameter in OpenFarms.

param.name: output_csv
param.dialogReference: If selected, a csv file will be written in the output folder. It does not include flood debasement and the soil type is not split in two. Acreage is rounded to 2 decimal places.

param.name: output_txt
param.dialogReference: If selected, a txt file will be written in the output folder. Soil type split in two sections. Flood debasement is included. Acreage is rounded to 2 decimal places.

param.name: output_shapefile
param.dialogReference: If selected, a shapefile of the result will be written to the output folder with the base file name. Every feature includes parcel ID, land use, soil type, and GIS acreage, with the addition of deeded acreage and flood debasement if those options are selected.

param.name: overwrite_input_config
param.dialogReference: Overwrites the input config file in the first parameter with the new settings when the Settings tool is run.

param.name: save_as
param.dialogReference: Write the settings to a new config file. If the input config file is selected here, it will switch to the overwrite input config parameter.

param.name: landUseCodes
param.expression: {Land Use Field {Numeric Code for export};Land Use Field {Numeric Code for export}...}
param.dialogReference: The values on the left should match all posible values in the land use field. If a new value is encountered "DEFAULT" will be used. The corresponding values on the right are written to the txt file.

param.name: csv_headings
param.dialogReference: Headings for the csv file. Do not add new headings or change the order, only change the names on the right.

tool.summary: Settings for OpenFarms tool. Writes settings to a config file, which is read by the main tool.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Settings for OpenFarms tool. Writes settings to a config file, which is read by the main tool.
